name: Matteo Sesia
content: Matteo Sesia - Matteo Sesia Matteo Sesia Statistician and Data Scientist. Associate Professor at the University of Southern California. Follow CV Google Scholar GitHub ORCID Email I am an Associate Professor (with tenure) in the Department of Data Sciences and Operations at the USC Marshall School of Business, with a courtesy appointment in Computer Science at the Viterbi School of Engineering. Before joining USC, I earned a Ph.D. in Statistics at Stanford University in 2020, advised by Emmanuel Candès. I am originally from Italy, where I studied at Politecnico di Torino and Collegio Carlo Alberto. Research Interests I develop statistical methods for analyzing complex, high-dimensional data using modern machine learning models. I am particularly interested in distribution-free and model-agnostic approaches that can produce precise statistical inferences under defensible assumptions. I sometimes also work as a consultant and expert collaborator in both academic and industry settings, helping to design reproducible data analyses, quantify uncertainty in complex models, and communicate results clearly to diverse audiences. Information for Prospective Students and Collaborators I welcome new collaborations and have several research projects that may be of interest to highly motivated Ph.D. students. If you are a current Ph.D. student at USC and would like to work with me, feel free to reach out by email. If you are not yet at USC but are considering applying to one of our Ph.D. programs, please visit the DSO Ph.D. program information page or the CS Ph.D. program information page. All applications are submitted through the departments’ standard admissions processes described on those pages. Recent Posts COPA 2025 Our team received both the best paper award and the best poster awards at COPA 2025. Google Research Scholar Award Received a Google Research Scholar award. ICML 2025 Two papers accepted at ICML 2025, of which one spotlighted (top 2.6% of submissions).
